alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 1:12PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River Above Carlin affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and slowly increase river flows. An active and wet pattern during the midweek could result an increase in levels along the Humboldt River. For the Upper Humboldt...including Elko, Carlin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Humboldt River Above Carlin. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, This is monitoring stage. No flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:25 PM PDT Monday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
